meanings.sent1: Loud noises can desensitize your ears over time.
meanings.sent2: Watching scary movies can desensitize you to fear.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's superpower was to desensitize himself to pain.
meanings.sent4: The constant exposure to violence in the media can desensitize society.
meanings.sent5: The gradual introduction of spicy food helped desensitize her taste buds.

meanings.definition: Make less likely to feel shock or distress.
meanings.sent1: Experiencing small shocks can desensitize you to bigger ones.
meanings.sent2: Therapy can help desensitize individuals to traumatic memories.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were so bad that they desensitized the audience to humor.
meanings.sent4: The repeated failure desensitized him to disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The continuous exposure to sad news desensitized her emotions.
